getting_started.title: Welcome {{userName}}
getting_started.subtitle: Get set up in just a few minutes with the steps below. Mark the items as completed when the step is done. You can always return to previous steps, and change / add any configuration from the Configuration menu item.

accounts.title: Accounts
accounts.subtitle: Manage the organizations that access and subscribe to your applications. Each user belongs to an account, and access can be granted at the account level, user level, or both. Learn more

users.title: Users
users.subtitle: All users across accounts that have been invited, logged in, or tried to login to your applications. In the Veriam Customer Portal you can manage users from your own organization. Learn more

applications.title: Applications
applications.subtitle:
Setup and configure applications that need access management. Veriam uses OpenID Connect (OIDC) protocol for authentication and authorization requests.

Access rules can be applied directly on the application, or through application-specific policies. Learn more

role_based.title: Role based access control
role_based.subtitle: Roles help manage what users and customer accounts can access in your applications. Assign roles directly or through licenses, with filters and permissions if needed. Learn more

policy_based.title: Policy based access control
policy_based.subtitle: Policies offer a flexible way to manage access, using rules and filters to decide who can do what. They can be assigned directly to users or customer accounts, or be made available through access licenses or subscriptions. Learn more

access_licenses.title: Access licenses
access_licenses.subtitle:
Manage the access licenses that contain the conditions for customers to get access to your application(s), as well as the access they get. They contain policies (to determine the access) and potential legal document requirements.

After an access license is provided to a customer organization, an administrator of the customer can distribute it to their users.

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
subscriptions.subtitle: View, update or assign subscription plans to customer accounts. Learn more

invoices.title: Invoices
invoices.subtitle: All subscription invoices issued to your customer accounts. Learn more

payments.title: Payments
payments.subtitle: All payments collected from your customer accounts for their active subscriptions. Learn more

plans.title: Plans
plans.subtitle: Create and manage subscription plans that define what customers get access to—and under what terms. Each plan has subscription based access control (SBAC), policies that control access to features and applications. Learn more

contracting.title: Templates
contracting.subtitle: Upload legal documents—like T&Cs, privacy policies, or NDAs—that customers need to agree to before accessing your services. Templates can be added to subscription plans. Learn more

logs.title: Logs
logs.subtitle: You can find the different logs of the Veriam platform here.

overview.title: Applications
overview.subtitle:
Here you can configure your applications that require access management. Veriam uses the OpenID Connect (OIDC) protocol for authentication and authorization requests. You will be provided with the Client ID and Client Secret after configuring your application.

After configuring your application, you can set access rules (policies) directly on the application, or use the application name in filters that can be added to policies.

app_name.label: Application name
app_name.info_text: This is only visible internally on Veriam Admin to identify your application.

description.label: Description
description.info_text: This is only visible internally on Veriam admin

url.label: URL
url.info_text: The URL where your application is hosted. This is only for use on Veriam Admin.

type.label: Type of application
type.info_text: Select the type of application you are configuring.

required_mfa.label: Require MFA on all logins
required_mfa.info_text: Enabling this will force all users to use MFA when logging in to this application.

config_url.label: Veriam Open ID URL
config_url.info_text: The Open ID Connect discovery URL of Veriam. You will need this in your application to setup the connection.

redirect_url.label: Redirect URLs
redirect_url.info_text: The URL where the user can get redirected to after authentication. Note that, especially if you provide multiple Redirect URLs, it is good practice to send a redirect URL in the authentication request.

attr_sets.title: Attribute sets
attr_sets.subtitle: Define which user or customer account details to request for your application signup process. You can create and manage attribute sets separately for users and customer accounts, then assign them to any application that needs them.

new_application_with_roles.title: Application wizard
new_application_with_roles.subtitle:
This wizard will help you setup your application with corresponding access requirements quickly and easily.

Simply follow the wizard below to get setup in minutes.

overview.title: Filters
overview.subtitle: Create and manage filters used to control when a policy should apply. Each filter can include one or more conditions. Can be nested for more advanced logic. Learn more

overview.title: Policies
overview.subtitle:
Manage user access by setting up and assigning policies with access. You can set up filters to determine the access rules as part of a policy.

Policies can be assigned directly to a customer organization or user, or made available via a Access License or Subscription (coming soon).

overview.title: Roles
overview.subtitle:
Manage user access by setting up and assigning role based policies. You can create 'Roles' (role names to return as part of the user information) and 'Permissions' (also returned as part of the user information) from the 'Manage Roles' and 'Manage Permissions' options.

Roles can be assigned directly to a customer organization or user, or made available via a Subscription.

overview.title: Resources
overview.subtitle: Resources are any objects in your application that need additional authorization. You can define resource attributes to describe them more specifically, and use both resources and resource attributes to control who gets access and when. Learn more

overview.title: Resource attributes
overview.subtitle: Resource attributes are specific attributes of your resources that you might want to use to determine if users should get access to the requested resource. Resource attributes can be used across different resources.

overview.title: Access licenses
overview.subtitle:
Manage the access licenses that contain the conditions for customers to get access to your application(s), as well as the access they get. They contain policies (to determine the access) and potential legal document requirements.

After an access license is provided to a customer organization, an administrator of the customer can distribute it to their users.

overview.title: Legal documents
overview.subtitle: Legal documents to be signed by customers to access your services. These could be T&Cs, Privacy Policy, NDA etc. that can be added to access licenses or plans to ensure the organization agrees to the terms before being able to use the license or subscription.

overview.title: Attribute sets
overview.subtitle:
Define which user or customer account details to request for your application signup process.

You can create and manage attribute sets separately for users and customer accounts, then assign them to any application that needs them. Learn more

overview.title: Plans
overview.subtitle: Subscription plans are structured offerings that define the features, pricing, and terms for your services. The policies in the plan determine access to applications or features.

pricing_page.title: Pricing page
pricing_page.subtitle: Create a pricing page that lets customers choose and subscribe to one of your available plans. Learn more

toast_messages.subitem_successfully_created: Item created. Don't forget to finish the configuration of this item later.

roles.subtitle: All the roles that are available to be used in policies.

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.subtitle: All the permissions that are available to be used in policies.

provide_support.subtitle:

continue logging in

permissions.title: Permissions
permissions.subtitle: All the permissions that are available to be used in policies.
